text: I'm trying out `Plots.jl` with the `PGFPlotsX` backend. The <https://kristofferc.github.io/PGFPlotsX.jl/stable/man/save.html|documentation> recommends using tikzscale if you want to be able to let the size of the plot be set in the TeX document while keeping line thicknesses and font sizes invariant. I am saving the figure via `savefig("filename.tikz")` and then doing `\includegraphics[width=.5\linewidth]{filename.tikz}` in my TeX document. However the size specified by `width=...` scales _everything_ (fonts, etc.). I discovered that `Plots -> PGFPlots backend -> tikz file` hardcodes `height` and `width` within the pgfplots axis options (based on `size` attribute in `Plots`). Is there a way to avoid this hardcoding (and thereby letting tikzscale handle the sizing)? I know using `PGFPlots.jl` directly does _not_ hardcode size.
